cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, aiming toward the southeast U.S. coastline (Carolinas/Georgia) late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Carolina coast (most likely between northern South Carolina and southern North Carolina)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from northern Florida through North Carolina, including the South Carolina shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm‐force winds possible late Thursday, with a chance of hurricane-force gusts if the track shifts southward
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for dangerous storm surge exceeding 3 ft along the lower South Carolina coast if Florence nears landfall to the north
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts, causing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large surf and life-threatening rip currents preceding the storm; possible port channel shoaling from wave action
